subtitleNullable: Fresh Water Fish Dataset (Rangamati Kaptai Lake and Sunamganj Hoar area)
descriptionNullable:
**     1.Kaptai Lake Freshwater Fish (Healthy and Disease)**

Source: Catch data of Kaptai Lake are supplied by Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation (BFDC). Other Inland Fish: Chapila, Tengra, Punti, Chital, Phali, Pabda, Bacha, Kazoli, Baim, Kakchki, Mola etc.Purpose of the catch assessment survey for the Kaptai Lake fisheries is to collect data on catch and fishing effort of the fisheries for estimating the total catch my months, fishing gear and by species. Bangladesh Fisheries Development Corporation (BFDC) usually provides yearly total production of Kaptai Lake fisheries. Original fish collected from Tobolchori Bazar and FishariGhat in Rangamati.

				                                     2.Sunamgong Haor Freshwater Fish (Disease Fish)

Description:the Sunamganj Community Based Resource Management Project (CBRMP). It contains a total of 126 fish species from 39 families found in the Sunamganj haor area. CBRMP has promoted community-based fisheries management approaches that, along with their livelihoods focus, are helping to preserve and enhance natural fish stocks in the hoar basin. World Fish support to LGED involves several areas including monitoring the impacts of CBRMP on fish catch, bio-diversity and livelihoods. Apart from pond fisheries, fisheries of haors play a very important role in the livelihood earning of haor people. Large areas of Sylhet, Mymensingh, Sunamganj, Habiganj, MoulviBazar, Kishoreganj and Netrokona districts are covered by many haors. The haor basin has its commercial and ecological importance for fish production. This feature presents some photographs of Epizootic Ulcerative Syndrome (EUS) or Red Spot disease affected fishes of different beels of Sunamganj haor area.

Photofeature: EUS disease affected fishes of haor area
Source: Balaram Mahalder
Website: http://en.bdfish.org/

English Name: Climbing perch
Bengali Name: Koi (কই)
IUCN (Bangladesh) Status: Not threatened
Habitat Status: Native

Barbodes sarana(Hamilton, 1822) In Haor Area:

English Name: Olive barb
Bengali Name: Sarputi (সরপুটি), Sarna puti (স্বর্ণাপুটি), Saral puti (সরল পুটি), Deshi sarputi (দেশী পুটি) and Kurti (কুর্তি)
IUCN (Bangladesh) Status: Critically Endangered
Habitat Status: Native

Labeo gonius (Hamilton-Buchanan, 1822) In Haor Area:

English Name: Kuria labeo
Bengali Name: Gonia (গোনিয়া), Ghainna (ঘাইন্না), Goni (গোনি) and Kurchi (কুরচি)
IUCN (Bangladesh) Status: Endangered
Habitat Status: Native

Mastacembelus armatus Lacepede, 1800 In Haor:

English Name: Tire-track spinyeel, Zig-zag eel
Bengali Name: Baim (বাইম), Bam(বাম), Sal baim(শাল বাইম)
IUCN (Bangladesh) Status: Endangered
Habitat Status: Native

Puntius sophore(Hamilton-Buchanan, 1822) In Haor Area:

English Name: Spot-fin swamp barb
Bengali Name: Punti (পুঁটি), Jat punti (জাত পুঁটি), Vadi punti (ভাদি পুঁটি)
IUCN (Bangladesh) Status: Not Threatened
Habitat Status: Native

Wallago attu (Bloch and Schneider, 1801) In Haor Fish

English Name: Wallago, Freshwater shark
Bengali Name: Boal (বোয়াল), Bol (বোল), Bal (বল), Boyali (বোয়ালী),
IUCN (Bangladesh) Status: Not threatened
Habitat Status: Native
